name: Cawl
description: Cawl is a hearty Welsh stew made of lamb and root vegetables, embodying a rich mix of local produce and traditional cooking. It's a comforting dish, especially popular during colder months.
steps: In a large pot, brown the lamb pieces, then remove and set aside.
In the same pot, saut√© onions, carrots, and leeks until slightly softened.
Return the lamb to the pot, add potatoes, and cover with water or stock.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, covering and cooking for at least 3 hours until the meat is tender and the vegetables are cooked.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and add chopped parsley before serving.
Serve hot, with a side of crusty bread.
ingredients: 500 grams lamb shoulder, cut into chunks
Water or lamb stock as needed
tips: Letting the cawl sit overnight enhances the flavors, making it even more delicious the next day.
Adding a turnip or swede can add an extra layer of flavor.
Be careful not to let the vegetables turn mushy by overcooking.
